ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Go to Pharaoh. He has overstepped the bounds.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Go to the Pharaoh as he has become exceedingly rebellious."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And go to Pharaoh now for he has transgressed all bounds."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Go to the Pharaoh; he has become a rebel."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Go to Fir`awn! Verily, he has transgressed."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Go to Firon, surely he has exceeded all limits.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Go to Pharaoh; he has waxed insolent.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Go thou unto Pharaoh! Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Go to Pharaoh; he has transgressed all bounds."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Go thou unto Fir'awn; verily he hath waxen exorbitant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Go to Pharaoh. He has indeed rebelled.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Go thou to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Go to Fir'aun (Pharaoh)! Verily, he has transgressed (all bounds in disbelief and disobedience, and has behaved as an arrogant, and as a tyrant)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Go to Pharaoh, he has become insolent'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Go to Pharaoh; He has transgressed.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:24]   Go, as a messenger [from God], to Pharaoh, and [to] those with him. He has indeed transgressed’, he has exceeded the [usual] limits in his disbelief by claiming to be a god.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Go thou unto Pharaoh! Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds)) he became arrogant, overweening and a disbeliever.
